greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write 2*n = p+q (p,q prime), p*q minimal; then a(n) = p*q.
comment: Least semiprime whose sum of prime factors equals 2*n.
Assuming Goldbach's conjecture, a(n) exists for all n >= 2. - _David James Sycamore_, Jan 08 2019
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
formula: For all n except 3, a(n) = A288814(2*n). - _David James Sycamore_, Jan 08 2019
mathematica: Array[Block[{p = 2, q}, While[! PrimeQ@ Set[q, 2 # - p], p = NextPrime[p]]; p q] &, 55, 2] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 02 2020 *)
results.author: _Werner D. Sand_, Aug 31 2002
